item.title: By: Daniel Schultz
item.dc:creator: Daniel Schultz
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/11/anonymous-project-update/#comment-174">Deadpoohbear</a>.
Many thanks for pointing that out (I never expected to be entirely correct!)
I'll add in a note reflecting this distinction. In fact, I'll add a note stressing how complex it all is.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Deadpoohbear.

Many thanks for pointing that out  (I never expected to be entirely correct!)

I’ll add in a note reflecting this distinction.  In fact, I’ll add a note stressing how complex it all is.

item.title: By: Deadpoohbear
item.dc:creator: Deadpoohbear
item.description: You are not entirely correct about Anon and the lulz, my friend. While there is a high priority placed on that, (especially among the youngest among us notably referred to as the lulzfags) there is also a very strong code of morality among others--especially where issues of censorship is involved. (This latter faction is, appropriately, referred to as the moralfags.) While there is no doubt that Anon's support of the Occupations has provided plenty of lulz fodder, make no mistake--we are RABIDLY serious about furthering that agenda.
item.content:encoded: You are not entirely correct about Anon and the lulz, my friend. While there is a high priority placed on that, (especially among the youngest among us notably referred to as the lulzfags) there is also a very strong code of morality among others–especially where issues of censorship is involved.  (This latter faction is, appropriately, referred to as the  moralfags.) While there is no doubt that Anon’s support of the Occupations has provided plenty of lulz fodder, make no mistake–we are RABIDLY serious about furthering that agenda.
